abstract.text: Returns the bounding rectangle for a control glyph, at the specified glyph position and character index in the text container.

inlineContent.text: Returns the bounding rectangle for the control glyph at
. The proposed line fragment rectangle is specified by
The typesetter calls this method when it encounters an
. The default behavior is to return zero width for control glyphs. A subclass can override this method to do something different, such as implement a way to display control characters.
can choose whether or not to map control characters to
. Tab characters, for example, do not use this facility.

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your macOS app.
A concrete typesetter object that places glyphs during the text layout process.
Returns the bounding rectangle for a control glyph, at the specified glyph position and character index in the text container.
Calculates the line fragment rectangle and the portion of the rectangle that contains marks.
Returns the hyphen character to be inserted after the specified glyph when hyphenation is enabled in the layout manager.
Returns the hyphenation factor in effect at the specified glyph index.
Sets a Boolean value that determines whether the layout manager invalidates the specified portion of the glyph cache.
Breaks a line by hyphenating before the character at the specified index.
Breaks a line by word-wrapping before the character at the specified index.
Notifies subclasses that the typesetter is about to set a new line fragment.
The reserved code for a control glyph.
An object that performs the initial, nominal glyph generation phase in the layout process.
A region where text layout occurs.
A point in a Cartesian coordinate system.
